intro: Comolia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian comolia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Due to its habitat in the dense Amazonian understory, it plays a role in the ecological balance of the region.
